programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Var, from Saint-Tropez to the Verdon Gorges Renowned for Saint-Tropez the department of the Var offers innumerable other idyllic destinations. We explore from the Bandol vineyards, bathed in southern sunshine and a mild Mediterranean climate, to the dramatic coast where the Corniche des Maures and the flame-red rocks of the Esterel Massif reveal their spectacular natural landscapes. Directed by: Audrey Varet (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Between Creuse and Corrèze, marvellous nature Exploring the great outdoors through mountains and magical scenery. We head to the heart of the Millevaches Plateau, a region also known as France's water tower because of the innumerable lakes and watercourses that have their sources here. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Picton, Ontario
Louis goes to Picton, in Ontario, to meet a client who is battling with a squirrel problem.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Breakfast for the "morning people" The chef Jean-Luc Boulay, from the restaurant Saint-Amour in Québec, offers the morning presenters, Patrick Masbourian, Ève-Marie Lortie and Kim Rusk, a real treat by preparing a meal that they had almost forgotten: breakfast. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Hydration and dehydration
How can you tell if you are drinking enough? Also on the programme: Les Herbes Salées du Bas-Saint-Laurent; haggis, the famous dish from Scotland; and black garlic from L'Île d'Orléans...
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Loire-Atlantique, from Guérande to the Côte de Jade We head for Nantes, proud capital of a region brimming with creativity, before visiting Guérande with its rich mediaeval past and salt marshes. Our journey then continues in the surprising Brière before coming to an end at Pornic as we discover a picturesque fishing harbour and elegant seaside villas. Directed by: Chloé Chovin (season 4, France, 2017)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Pyrenees in winter, in harmony with nature Snow, cold and vast open spaces, the scene is set! Join us for a trip through the Pyrenees, to meet some of those who love winter, a season as intoxicating as it is demanding, and decided to make the most of their passion whilst also respecting the environment. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
Louis helps out at the house of someone who has involuntarily sheltered pigeons, squirrels and an entire family of raccoons.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: A little trip to Charlevoix Christian heads off to meet friends on the other side of the river, in the delightful region of Charlevoix. Pioneer in making the most of its terroir in terms of food, it offers a unique culinary trail under the expert guidance of the top chef Jean Soulard. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Own brands
Are own brands, generally sold at lower prices, good quality? Also on the programme: how to prepare tempeh, the Indonesian speciality made from fermented soybeans? Discovering all about Argentinean maté and the traditional Portuguese soup, caldo verde.
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
The roadside diners of the Lower St Lawrence
In the Lower St Lawrence region, two roadside diners offer a menu where seafood takes centre stage. Who could resist a visit! We also discover peameal bacon, Charlotte's market and join tourists on the trail of good food in Montreal and Ottawa...
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: La National Gallery of Art, Washington Fondée en 1937, la National Gallery of Art, à Washington, est l'un des plus imposants musées au monde par l'importance des oeuvres présentées. Les collections sont réparties dans deux bâtiments distincts, reliés par une galerie sous le Mall. On y retrouvera les grands noms français de la peinture moderne. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: République dominicaine Découverte du marché de Saint-Domingue. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Hérault, from Sète to the Hérault Valley From the foothills of the Massif Central to Mediterranean Sea, with time out to explore the garrigue and lowland plains of the Languedoc winegrowing region, the Hérault reveals the contrasting beauty of its terroir. Saint-Guilhem-le-Désert, its narrow mediaeval streets and fascinating mix of buildings, offers a veritable journey through time. Directed by: Louisa Ould Ahmed (season 4, France, 2017)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Pyrenees in winter, in harmony with nature Snow, cold and vast open spaces, the scene is set! Join us for a trip through the Pyrenees, to meet some of those who love winter, a season as intoxicating as it is demanding, and decided to make the most of their passion whilst also respecting the environment. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Espinouse Massif
In the Espinouse Massif, we meet Lilian and his swarm of bees. At the Les Taillades Farm, Aline and Guillaume have plenty to keep them busy, between caring for the animals and maturing the cheeses. All you need to know about the Pardailhan turnip; exploring the Hérépian Bell Museum.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Who understands Burgundian? Sandwiched between Paris and Lyon and spanning Burgundy's four départements, the Morvan area has own unique characteristics and customs. Can someone from Belfort, Jura or even Dijon understand the Burgundian language? Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Don Giovanni "Don Giovanni", the work that Richard Wagner considered to be "the opera of all operas"! Composed in 1787 by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, to a libretto by Lorenzo da Ponte. In 2019, it was staged and directed by Ivo Van Hove at the Palais Garnier, Paris... Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Hérault, from Sète to the Hérault Valley From the foothills of the Massif Central to Mediterranean Sea, with time out to explore the garrigue and lowland plains of the Languedoc winegrowing region, the Hérault reveals the contrasting beauty of its terroir. Saint-Guilhem-le-Désert, its narrow mediaeval streets and fascinating mix of buildings, offers a veritable journey through time. Directed by: Louisa Ould Ahmed (season 4, France, 2017)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
They're the future of fashion: discover the fashion show for students of the Institut Français de la Mode. Learn all about the padded jacket. Interview with Valentine H Despointes, a leatherwork artist. Wearing the colour brown. The architect Régis Botta presents one of his projects: a bright, simple duplex.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Michel Roth
He is one of France's most highly-qualified chefs. Michel Roth is back in Marseille, where he spent his childhood and learned his trade. An opportunity for the Lorraine-born chef to immerse himself in the land he loves, surrounded by family and friends: where good food is served with emotion.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as an outdoor adventure guide On the banks of Cambell River, Julien meets up with Bastian. Former banker turned helicopter pilot, he left Switzerland to start again from nothing. He takes Julien off to explore the endless playground that surrounds him, by boat, campervan and air. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie

How can you tell if you are drinking enough? Also on the programme: Les Herbes Salées du Bas-Saint-Laurent; haggis, the famous dish from Scotland; and black garlic from L'Île d'Orléans...

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: La National Gallery of Art, Washington Fondée en 1937, la National Gallery of Art, à Washington, est l'un des plus imposants musées au monde par l'importance des oeuvres présentées. Les collections sont réparties dans deux bâtiments distincts, reliés par une galerie sous le Mall. On y retrouvera les grands noms français de la peinture moderne. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Cantal, from Salers to the Cantal volcano A volcano, forging the beauty of the scenery; gentians growing on the majestic slopes of Puy Mary... From the old town of Salers to the spa village of Chaudes-Aigues, via Pesteils, Anjony and the Gabarit Viaduct, the Cantal offers us all its treasures: natural, architectural and deliciously gourmet. Directed by: Pierre Lalanne-Labeyrie (season 4, France, 2017)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Pyrenees in winter, in harmony with nature Snow, cold and vast open spaces, the scene is set! Join us for a trip through the Pyrenees, to meet some of those who love winter, a season as intoxicating as it is demanding, and decided to make the most of their passion whilst also respecting the environment. programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Homemade corn tortillas
For an easy-to-prepare way to serve prawn tacos and a mango salsa, Ricardo cooks his own home-made corn tortillas for a flavour that's even more authentic.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
The growing offer of own brands
With their own brands, the big distribution chains increase their profit margins and boost customer loyalty. Investigation. Also, the brining process, additives in processed foods and an introduction to the Swedish saffron buns called "lussekatter".
Presenters: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: L'ancienne et la nouvelle pinacothèque de Munich Halte dans deux « temples » allemands, dédiés à l'art, appréciés pour la richesse de leurs collections. L'ancienne pinacothèque de Munich recèle un grand nombre de tableaux de peintres français de la période classique, de Claude Lorrain à Fragonard. La nouvelle pinacothèque abrite, elle, les artistes romantiques et impressionnistes. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Don Pasquale "Don Pasquale", the comic opera by Gaetano Donizetti and Giovanni Ruffini was performed for the first time at the Comédie-Italienne in Paris, in 1843. Damiano Michieletto made the opera his own when he produced it at the Opéra de Paris in 2018. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)
